captions.text: - Why would you do this to us?
- Cause it's all about the beaver.

- Peanut Butter, that should
be interesting. - Wow, really?

- Molt, oats, lactose, hops,
yeast, and natural flavors.
- It kind of smells like a Reese's Pieces.

- I'm digging it. I'm
digging it. I'm digging it.
- I don't know. Is it too early to go
five out of five right out of the gate?
- High Water Brewing Camp Fire Stout.
- It evokes fond memories of wilderness

but I know it's not going
to taste like candy.
Hey! This beer would be good for kids!
Don't include that in the video.
- Oh, no no no no no. No no no no no!

- I'm not getting s'more
out of this at all.
- Out of one out of five?
- Sorry, we've already had a couple beers.

- Fancy pants.
- Don't mind if I do.
- Is it this style of doughnut?

- Maybe.
- I feel like a chiffon's a nice,
- Oh, that looks like dehydrated pee.
- It seriously smells like cleaning fluid.
- A doughnut should be a doughnut,
and a beer should be a beer.
"Long ago, ale was known as liquid bread."
- Wow, you know what? It's not even just
banana bread, it's the yellow laffy taffy,
which is my favorite laffy taffy.
- Nope, I don't like it. I don't like it.
- No, it taste like banana candy.
- When you say banana bread beer,

- No carbs in here.
- You're right.

- I think this could
give you a tummy ache.

- Why flavor something unless
it's better than normal beer?
- You don't do what you claim to be.
- This is going to be good as hell.
It doesn't say what award it won.

It's like Willy Wonka.
- It's like super dark.

- You don't like it?
- I don't like it.
What would you pair it with?

- It's not too chocolaty, though.
- No.

Double chocolate? I don't
even taste half chocolate.
Yeah, it smells like off brand chocolate

with a hotel coffee.
- Oh god.
- You know, like hotel coffee? It's free,
and it's in the lobby, but it's not good?

So you like, put a little
of your hot chocolate

packet in to make like,
an impromptu mocha?
But you're tired, so you drink it.

comments.text:
did you know that banana candy was originally based off of a banana from 
another country that slowly made it's way here, and when it did, people 
tried it, liked it, and turned it into candy. Later on, they forgot that it 
was bananas and so it affected many candies which is why some candies taste 
vaguely like bananas. Finally, someone took a trip to the state of the 
strange bananas and decided to make a candy solley from them, creating the 
banana candy we know today.﻿
